info.title: Event Portal - Designer
info.description:
REST API Concepts

Solace PubSub+ Event Portal provides REST APIs that you can use to manage your data in PubSub+ Cloud. 
The REST APIs allow you to model your event-driven architectures from your own client applications.

The following document describes the public REST APIs available for use in Event Portal 2.0. Objects created in this 
version will not be available in Event Portal 1.0. APIs that display (Beta) in their summary are provided as-is and 
are subject to change or removal. They may not be of the quality expected for generally available APIs and have no 
guaranteed forward compatibility with the generally available version of the API.

servers.description: Solace PubSub+ Cloud US EAST Region

post.description:
Use this API to execute a change application domain operation.

Token Permissions: [ `application_domain:move_contents:*` ]

202.description: Successfully executed a change application domain operation.

get.summary: Get a change application domain operation's details
get.description:
Use this API to retrieve a single change application domain operation by its ID.

Token Permissions: [ event_designer:access ]

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the change application domain operation.

get.summary: Get a list of the application domains
get.description:
Use this API to get a list of application domains that match the given parameters.

Token Permissions: [ event_designer:access ]

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of application domains to get per page.

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: The page number to get.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name to be used to match the application domain.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: Match only application domains with the given IDs separated by commas.

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: Specify extra data to be included, options are: stats

200.description: Get a list of application domains and the accompanying metadata.

post.description:
To help keep your event-driven architecture organized, use application domains to create namespaces for your applications, events and schemas.

Token Permissions: [ `application_domain:create:*` ]

requestBody.description: Application domains have a name and topic domain.

201.description: Created. The newly saved application domain is returned in the response body.

get.summary: (Beta) Get application domains and their entities for export
get.description:
Get application domains and their entities and export them as a JSON file that can be used to create new application domains in other PubSub+ accounts. This API is intended for providing application domain data to other accounts and not for data storage or backup. Your token must have one of the permissions listed in the Token Permissions.

Token Permissions: [ application_domain:export:* ]

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: The IDs of the application domains to export

200.description: Export file containing the application domains and accompanying entities

post.summary: (Beta) Create application domains and their entities from import
post.description:
Create new application domains and their nested entities by importing application domains that have been previously exported from a PubSub+ account. Your token must have one of the permissions listed in the Token Permissions.

Token Permissions: [ `application_domain:import:*` ]

202.description: Successfully registered import job with location identified in the response header

parameters.description: The number of items to return per page.

parameters.description: The page number to retrieve.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
The sorting criteria for the returned results. You can sort the results by query parameter in ascending or descending order.
Define the sort order using the following string: `fieldname:asc/desc` where:

- `fieldname` — The field name of the query parameter to sort by.
- `asc` — Sort the selected field name in ascending order.
- `desc` — Sort the selected field name in descending order.

If the direction is not specified, the default is ascending.

You can use multiple query parameters to refine the sorting order.

get.summary: Get the AsyncAPI specification for an application version
get.description:
Use this API to get the AsyncAPI specification for an application version annotated with Event Portal metadata. Deprecation Date: 2025-01-20 Removal Date: 2026-01-20 Reason: Replaced by /applicationVersions/{applicationVersionId}/exports/asyncAPI

Token Permissions: [ application:generate_async_api:* ]

parameters.name: applicationVersionId
parameters.description: The ID of the application version.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: The format in which to get the AsyncAPI specification. Possible values are yaml and json.

parameters.name: showVersioning
parameters.description: Include versions in each AsyncAPI object's name when only one version is present

parameters.name: includedExtensions
parameters.description: The event portal database keys to include for each AsyncAPI object.

parameters.name: asyncApiVersion
parameters.description: The version of AsyncAPI to use.

parameters.name: environmentOptions
parameters.description:
Determines whether bindings are applied to declared subscribed events or published subscribed events in the event mesh or both.
Replacement: Use expand instead.
Reason: The change is to allow for increased flexibility of the API.
Removal Date: 2025-09-20 18:00:00.000.

parameters.name: messagingServiceId
parameters.description:
Applies bindings from attracted events that are published in this messaging service's modeled event mesh.
Replacement: Use contextId with contextType instead.
Reason: The change is to allow for increased flexibility of the API.
Removal Date: 2025-09-20 18:00:00.000.

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description: A comma separated list of sections of the asyncapi document to include.

parameters.name: contextId
parameters.description: Applies bindings from subscribed events that are published in this event broker or event mesh.

parameters.name: contextType
parameters.description: The context of which events are attracted from.

200.description: The AsyncAPI specification for the application version.

get.summary: Get a list of applications
get.description:
Use this API to get a list of applications that match the given parameters.

Token Permissions: [ event_designer:access ]

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of applications to get per page.

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: The page number to get.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the application to match on.

parameters.name: applicationDomainId
parameters.description: Match only applications in the given application domain.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: Match only applications with the given IDs separated by commas.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
The sorting criteria for the returned results. You can sort the results by query parameter in ascending or descending order.
Define the sort order using the following string: `fieldname:asc/desc` where:

- `fieldname` — The field name of the query parameter to sort by.
- `asc` — Sort the selected field name in ascending order.
- `desc` — Sort the selected field name in descending order.

If the direction is not specified, the default is ascending.

You can use multiple query parameters to refine the sorting order.

parameters.name: customAttributes
parameters.description:
Returns the entities that match the custom attribute filter.
To filter by custom attribute name and value, use the format: `customAttributes===`.
To filter by custom attribute name, use the format: `customAttributes=`.
The filter supports the `AND` operator for multiple custom attribute definitions (not multiple values for a given definition). Use `;` (`semicolon`) to separate multiple queries with `AND` operation.
Note: the filter supports custom attribute values containing only the characters `[a-zA-Z0-9_\-\. ]`.

parameters.name: applicationType
parameters.description: Match only applications with the given applicationType.

200.description: Get a list of applications and the accompanying metadata.

post.description:
To model your event-driven architecture, applications are a fundamental building block for modelling the producers and consumers of events. Use this API to create applications and model the events they produce and consume.

Token Permissions: [ `application:create:*` ]

requestBody.description: Applications have a name and live within an application domain. Events can be added to the application as produced or consumed.

201.description: Created an application. Returns the newly saved application in the response body.
